definition[0]: the act of formally ending a parliament, business, or marriage
example[0]: The president announced the dissolution of the National Assembly.
definition[1]: the act of breaking up an organization, institution etc so that it no longer exists
definition[2]: the process by which something gradually becomes weaker and disappears
example[2]: the eventual dissolution of class barriers
definition[3]: when a company or PARTNERSHIP comes to an end officially
example[3]: Failure to agree terms could result in the outgoing partner seeking a formal dissolution of the firm on peremptory notice.
